content.question: Let f be the function given by <math> <mrow> <mi>f</mi> <mrow> <mo>(</mo> <mi>x</mi> <mo>)</mo> </mrow> <mo>=</mo> <mfrac> <mrow> <mn>2</mn> <mi>x</mi> </mrow> <mrow> <msqrt> <mrow> <msup> <mi>x</mi> <mn>2</mn> </msup> <mo>+</mo> <mi>x</mi> <mo>+</mo> <mn>1</mn> </mrow> </msqrt> </mrow> </mfrac> </mrow> </math>. (a) Find the domain of f. Justify your answer.

frqParts.text: Let f be the function given by <math> <mrow> <mi>f</mi> <mrow> <mo>(</mo> <mi>x</mi> <mo>)</mo> </mrow> <mo>=</mo> <mfrac> <mrow> <mn>2</mn> <mi>x</mi> </mrow> <mrow> <msqrt> <mrow> <msup> <mi>x</mi> <mn>2</mn> </msup> <mo>+</mo> <mi>x</mi> <mo>+</mo> <mn>1</mn> </mrow> </msqrt> </mrow> </mfrac> </mrow> </math>. (a) Find the domain of f. Justify your answer.
(b) In the viewing window provided below, sketch the graph of f.
(c) Write an equation for each horizontal asymptote of the graph of f.
(d) Find the range of f. Use f′(x) to justify your answer. Note: f′(x) = x + 2 / (x2 + x +1)3/2

topic.text: 1.15: Connecting Limits at Infinity and Horizontal Asymptotes

skill.text: Skill 2.D: Identify how mathematical characteristics or properties of functions are related in different representations.
